bioghist.p: From 1971 to 1974 Botwinick was the first Assistant Director for Art at the Philadelphia Museum of Art, a newly created post. He left to become the Director of the Brooklyn Museum and, from 1982 to 1987 served as Director of the Corcoran Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C. In 1987 he became senior vice president of Knoedler-Modarco in New York City and in 2001 he was named director of the Hudson River Museum in Yonkers, NY.

scopecontent.p: The records of Michael Botwinick, Assistant Director of Art, include curatorial department records, exhibition files, and subject files. Curatorial department records consist of correspondence and internal memoranda regarding activities in the various curatorial departments of the Museum as well as files related to the work of the Education and Development departments. Exhibition files consist of incoming and outgoing correspondence and memoranda related to selection of subjects, loans of works, insurance, and other records. Exhibitions documented here include "Dutch Masterpieces from the 18th Century," 1971-1972, "The Architecture of Frank Furness," 1973, and a Marcel Duchamp retrospective of 1973. Subject files include records on art sales and rental, the fuel shortage and its effect on the museum, rehabilitation of office space, and the museum shop and restaurant. The collection also includes a small number of personnel files, including policies and resumes.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
